channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Tech companies warn H-1B visa holders to avoid foreign travel
item.description: Microsoft Corp., Alphabet Inc., Amazon.com Inc. and other tech companies sent messages to affected employees telling them to return to the US on Satur...

item.title: White House scrambles to clear up H-1B visa confusion after panic throws corporate America into chaos overnight
item.description: "This is NOT an annual fee," White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt said. "It’s a one-time fee that applies only to the petition."

item.title: Even Disney stars are joining calls to boycott the media giant after ABC suspended Jimmy Kimmel’s show
item.description: The internet was already lighting up with users sharing screenshots of canceled subscriptions to Disney-owned streaming services or canceled vacations...

item.title: Trump is already wielding his ‘golden share’ authority at U.S. Steel, overriding the company’s plans for an Illinois plant, report says
item.description: This marks the latest move by the administration to exert power over private industry.

item.title: Luigi Mangione’s lawyers attack Pam Bondi for turning his arrest into a ‘Marvel movie’ that fatally prejudiced his case
item.description: "There has never been a situation remotely like this one where prejudice has been so great against a death-eligible defendant," Mangione's team argued...

item.title: Forget chips: The next battleground in the U.S.-China AI race is nuclear power
Why the bull market for stocks may now hinge on the 10-year Treasury yield
Gen Z fell in love with high-yield cash savings. The Fed just crashed the party.
Stocks often suffer in late September. Why the bears may be kept away this time.
Can Taylor Swift save the movie industry again with her ‘Showgirl’ film release?
